http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.value: (This article is about Indianapolis, Marion County, Indiana specifically. For unified governments generally, see Consolidated city-county.) Unigov is the name adopted by the city of Indianapolis, Indiana to describe its consolidated city–county government. By an act of the Indiana state legislature, Indianapolis consolidated with the government of Marion County in 1970. Within Unigov are eleven "included towns", which maintain some of their own municipal services and identity within the consolidated government. Four other municipalities in Marion County are not part of the Indianapolis government ("excluded cities and towns"), but receive county-level services from Unigov and are represented by the Indianapolis City–County Council and mayor. http://dbpedia.org/ontology/abstract.value: (This article is about Indianapolis, Marion County, Indiana specifically. For unified governments generally, see Consolidated city-county.) Unigov is the name adopted by the city of Indianapolis, Indiana to describe its consolidated city–county government. By an act of the Indiana state legislature, Indianapolis consolidated with the government of Marion County in 1970. Within Unigov are eleven "included towns", which maintain some of their own municipal services and identity within the consolidated government. Four other municipalities in Marion County are not part of the Indianapolis government ("excluded cities and towns"), but receive county-level services from Unigov and are represented by the Indianapolis City–County Council and mayor. The area of Marion County not within the included or excluded towns is known as the balance.
